pull.title: init: Return EXIT_SUCCESS on interrupt
pull.body:
Reported by dergoegge on irc.

An interrupt does not create a failure exit code during normal operation. This should also be the case when interrupt is triggered during initialization. However a failure exit code is currently returned if an interrupt occurs during init. Fix this by making `AppInitMain` return true instead of false on interrupt, which further up the call stack currently sets the `EXIT_FAILURE` code. Also add a check for the interrupt condition during GUI startup. Returning `EXIT_SUCCESS` seems to be the usual behaviour for daemons, see the discussion on IRC for this: https://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2026-01-08.html#l-146 .

Best reviewed with `--color-moved=dimmed-zebra --color-moved-ws=ignore-all-space`.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/34224. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | ACK | [maflcko](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34224#issuecomment-3725511979), [janb84](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34224#pullrequestreview-3641218737), [dergoegge](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34224#pullrequestreview-3643434420) | | Concept ACK | [bensig](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34224#issuecomment-3721249888) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore. ### Conflicts Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones: * [#bitcoin-core/gui/870](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/870) ([DRAFT] Expose AssumeUTXO Load Snapshot Functionality To The GUI by D33r-Gee) If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

I don't think this works. At least locally, I am still seeing `1` when I `^C` later. I used a diff to make this easier to test:

```diff
diff --git a/src/init.cpp b/src/init.cpp
index f2af858eb4..b6e903c497 100644
--- a/src/init.cpp
+++ b/src/init.cpp
@@ -1828,2 +1828,6 @@ bool AppInitMain(NodeContext& node, interfaces::BlockAndHeaderTipInfo* tip_info)
 
+    std::cout << "a\n";
+    UninterruptibleSleep(1s);
+    std::cout << "b\n";
+
     // As LoadBlockIndex can take several minutes, it's possible the user
```

So it now works fine when pressing `^C` before `b` is printed, but not after:

```
$ ./bld-cmake/bin/bitcoind -noprinttoconsole=1 
a
^Cb
$ echo $?
0  # works correctly
$ ./bld-cmake/bin/bitcoind -noprinttoconsole=1 
a
b
^C $?
1  # wrong exit code?
```

if an interrupt occurs during init. Fix this by making `AppInitMain` return
true instead of false, which further up the call stack sets the

events.message:
init: Fix non-zero code on interrupt

An interrupt does not create a failure exit code during normal
operation. This should also be the case when interrupt is triggered
during initialization. However a failure exit code is currently returned
if an interrupt occurs during init. Fix this by making `AppInitMain` return
true instead of false, which further up the call stack sets the
`EXIT_FAILURE` code. Also add a check for the interrupt condition during
GUI startup.

events.body:
Updated 3dbbac09f25a8337b75858a42386c8d7f8f1af92 -> 997e7b4d7cf7c4622938798423447375383184c0 ([init_interrupt_zero_0](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/init_interrupt_zero_0) -> [init_interrupt_zero_1](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/init_interrupt_zero_1), [compare](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/compare/init_interrupt_zero_0..init_interrupt_zero_1))

* Addressed @maflcko's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34224#issuecomment-3724878727), added previously missed case for returning after a shutdown is detected. These are kind of difficult to find exhaustively, but I did reproduce the missing case too, and this seems to fix it for me.

ACK 997e7b4d7cf7c4622938798423447375383184c0

PR fixes exit code on SIGINT while being in init. 

While I was first under the impression that the exit code should be 130 (as per [Advanced Bash-Scripting Guide:](https://tldp.org/LDP/abs/html/exitcodes.html)) because of `SIGINT`, this is not the case. `SIGINT` is correctly handled by the application ending in a clean shutdown so it should be 0 (which is the case after this PR)
 
e.g. killing a bitcoin node with `SIGKILL` results in a 137 
<details>

``` bash
2026-01-08T20:26:49Z dnsseed thread exit
Killed: 9                  ./bitcoind --regtest

[nix-shell:~/Projects/bitcoin/build_dev_mode/bin]$ echo $?
137
```
</details>
